skills.skill: Technical Proficiency (PI, DCS, Excel, PowerPoint, Word)

duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage safety, housekeeping, environmental, and training aspects of the hourly workforce in the board machine area.
Work closely with supervisors to manage crew's performance, write work requests, and lead productivity teams.
Assist in the design/installation/operator training/startup of new equipment, covering daily/weekend calls, and acting as a relief foreman.
Drive safety improvements, address safety concerns, and reduce area exposure risks in the Board Mill department.
Troubleshoot equipment and processes, identify problems, repair, and optimize systems.
Investigate alternative equipment and process designs, manage area overtime, and oversee operator training.
Develop capital and expense budgets, track, analyze, optimize, and report on Key Performance Indicators for the Board Mill.
Manage and direct railroad on daily switch requirements, inventory shipping dunnage supplies, and report track roll/bale inventory levels.
Be proficient in the use of PI and DCS systems, as well as Excel, Gannt charting, PowerPoint, and Word.

education_certification.credential: Prefer candidate with a college degree. Prefer degree in chemical/electrical/mechanical engineering field and minimum of 5 years of work experience related to paper making. Knowledge of coatings or coating application in addition to paper making experience would be a plus. Good oral and written communication skills are required.
